name: moonwalk
content:
moonwalk noun [C]
(ON MOON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
an act of walking on the moon: the 50th anniversary of the first moonwalk
More examplesFewer examples The hours of astronaut moonwalk video are far too complex to have been faked.On July 20, 1969, about one-fifth of the world population watched Neil Armstrong's iconic moonwalk.

moonwalk noun [C]
(DANCE)
a dance step in which you walk backwards in a smooth movement, sliding your feet along the floor: Michael Jackson's famous moonwalk
More examplesFewer examplesThe 1983 hit "Billie Jean" became a signature song for the pop star when he sang and danced the moonwalk.He was as slick and smooth onstage as Michael Jackson, minus the moonwalk.

to walk backwards in a smooth movement, sliding your feet along the floor, especially as part of a dance: She moonwalked across the stage. Related word
moonwalking
More examplesFewer examplesMichael Jackson's "Billie Jean" provides the soundtrack to a segment on a bird that appears to moonwalk.Would it really be so hard for one of the candidates to moonwalk on stage?
